title: [K-12] Problem Solving and Learning Support for Children with Autism Using Vibrotactile Interfaces

context.prior_knowledge: Basic scientific knowledge and fundamental understanding of digital device usage
context.additional_context: Conducted in a limited-technology smartphone-based environment, participants practice problem-solving strategies and tactile learning design methods for children with autism in a simulation setting

learning_goals: Participants will design and execute problem-solving scenarios using a Vibrotactile Haptic Interface (VHI).
Participants will develop customized tactile learning content by analyzing learning preferences of children with autism.
Participants will analyze and report the educational effectiveness of VHI models through project-based assessments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
